title: Kirsten Dunst looks sweet as she soaks up the LA sunshine at the Veuve Clicquot Polo Classic
text:
Just a month after the show's premiere, Showtime renewed the Kirsten Dunst led dark comedy series, On Becoming a God in Central Florida, for a second season, Deadline reports.

But on Saturday, Dunst, 37, soaked up all the free time she has left before filming for the next chapter begins.

The Bring It On star was photographed in a sleek, summery dress at the 10th Annual Veuve Clicquot Polo Classic in Pacific Palisades, Los Angeles.

Taking a break: Kirsten Dunst, 37, was photographed in a sleek, summery dress at the 10th Annual Veuve Clicquot Polo Classic in Pacific Palisades, Los Angeles

The Melancholia star's dress featured cap sleeves, a ballerina hemline, a tie around the waist and a red and green floral pattern.

It also featured an important pair of sewn-in pockets where Dunst hid her hands.

She paired the look with black platform sandals as she stood in the grass in front of flowers and a garden of champagne.

The Spider-Man actress wore her blonde locks down in styled curls that cascaded over her shoulders.

Summer chic: The Melancholia star's dress featured cap sleeves, a ballerina hemline, a tie around the waist and a red and green floral pattern

Styled to perfection: The Spider-Man actress wore her blonde locks down in styled curls that cascaded over her shoulders

The outing comes just over a week after Showtime announced they'd be renewing its critically acclaimed comedy On Becoming A God In Central Florida, in which Dunst stars.

She plays the role of Krystal Stubbs in the show, a minimum-wage water park employee who lies, schemes and cons her way up the ranks of the cultish, multibillion dollar pyramid scheme that drove her family to ruin.

The Marie Antoinette star previously told TheWrap that what sold her on the project was getting to tell a story 'about the inner rage of a woman who’s swallowed too much s–t.'

'I almost backed out a couple of times, but it kept calling me back,' she said.

Back to work: Kirsten is currently starring in the TV series On Becoming A God In Central Florida, her first series regular role since playing Peggy Blumquist in the second season of Fargo back in 2015

'It was just too good. It was too fun of a role to play and the whole world was so weird to me and I'd never seen anything like it on television,' Dunst continued.

The part is her first series regular role since she played Peggy Blumquist in the second season of Fargo, where she met her now fiancé, Jesse Plemons, 31.

Since then, Dunst has been busy with her love life and family life.

She got engaged to Plemons in 2017 and gave birth to their 1-year-old son, Ennis, last year.
description: Her show, On Becoming a God in Central Florida has already been renewed for a second season. And Saturday, Dunst soaked up all the free time she has left before filming begins again.
